: Novelty ry
] This paper proposes a drone-based continuous surveillance system for national border
4 | Smart Border Patrol U... security, specifically designed to address the challenges of drone battery limitations and
| Summar extensive border lengths. It introduces a novel dynamic wireless charging system (E-line)
1 y embedded along the surveillance path, which enables drones to recharge without needing to
4 Highlight return to base. A multi-objective mixed-integer nonlinear programming (MINLP) model is
1 developed to minimize both the number of drones and the total length of E-lines required, while
4 Novelty ensuring that every border segment is revisited within a safety-critical time interval based on its
] threat level. The approach is validated with a case study on the U.S.—Mexico border.
1 UAV-Enabled Intellige...
Highlight
Summary
The system enables non-stop drone patrol operations by integrating wireless charging
Highlight directly into the flight path, ensuring high-frequency surveillance without manual battery swaps.
The model also incorporates surveillance criticality scoring, optimizing revisit times
1 Novelty dynamically based on border threat levels.
7 Design of UAV Autono... Novelty
7 Summary wo . . : oo oo
4 This is one of the first studies to integrate dynamic wireless charging into a drone-based
1 Highlight border patrol optimization model. It not only introduces the E-line as a technical solution, but
J gg also formulates and solves a realistic, budget-constrained patrol problem, balancing security
a Novelty coverage with resource limitations. The inclusion of drone path speed control for energy
] optimization adds further depth to operational planning.
